memoryVerse: "No! We believe that it is through the grace of our Lord Jesus that we are saved, just as they are." â€“ Acts 15:11

one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. Use this space to record how you have seen God's activity during the week. (How has He provided, answered, comforted, reconciled, guided, etc.?)
2. What from the notes, lecture, group sharing or personal study impacted you most in the past week?

two.title:
SECOND DAY: Read Hebrews 1.
Jesus Christ is superior to all creation.

questions.questionText: 3. Describe the supremacy and attributes of Jesus? How does this encourage, comfort or challenge you?
4. Compare Jesus to angels. What do you learn?
5. What's significant about the Old Testament references which describe Jesus and His work? What confidence does this give you in Jesus and His Word?

three.title:
THIRD DAY: Read Hebrews 2.
Jesus became human to save people.

questions.questionText: 6. Why was it necessary for Jesus to become human? What do you learn about Jesus and the salvation He provides?
7. What is the warning in vs. 1-4? What is the consequence of ignoring the warning?
8. What fears and temptations do you struggle with? How does the truth of Jesus' death bring freedom for you?

four.title:
FOURTH DAY: Read Hebrews 3.
Jesus is greater than Moses.

questions.questionText: 9. What are similarities and differences between Jesus and Moses?
10. What are practical ways a person may fix their thoughts on Jesus? Why is this important?
11. How does Christian community help believers guard against a hardened heart?

five.title:
FIFTH DAY: Read Hebrews 4:1-13.
God's promise of entering rest still stands.

questions.questionText: 12. a. In what ways is the term "rest" used in these verses?
12. b. How does a person enter God's rest? Have you entered this rest? (If not, why not?)
13. What do you learn about God's Word? How might this impact the way you read and listen to the Bible?
14. What is the most important or challenging thing you learned this week?
15. Passage Discovery (homiletics, word study, etc.) for group and administrative leaders: Hebrews 1:1-4:13
